trans-unit.source: Automate protection between an on-premises VMM site and Azure using PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Automate protection between an on-premises VMM site and Azure using PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Automate the deployment of Azure Site Recovery using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Automate the deployment of Azure Site Recovery using PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell® is a task-based command-line shell and scripting language designed especially for system administration.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell® is a task-based command-line shell and scripting language designed especially for system administration.

trans-unit.source: The use of PowerShell cmdlets for Azure Site Recovery is supported between a Hyper-V site that VMM manages and Azure.
trans-unit.target: The use of PowerShell cmdlets for Azure Site Recovery is supported between a Hyper-V site that VMM manages and Azure.

trans-unit.source: Azure Site Recovery contributes to your business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) strategy by orchestrating replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines in a number of deployment scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Azure Site Recovery contributes to your business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) strategy by orchestrating replication, failover and recovery of virtual machines in a number of deployment scenarios.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of deployment scenarios see the <linkText>Azure Site Recovery overview</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a full list of deployment scenarios see the <linkText>Azure Site Recovery overview</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to use PowerShell to automate common tasks for deploying Azure Site Recovery, including orchestrating and automating protection for workloads running on virtual machines on Hyper-V host servers that are located in VMM private clouds.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to use PowerShell to automate common tasks for deploying Azure Site Recovery, including orchestrating and automating protection for workloads running on virtual machines on Hyper-V host servers that are located in VMM private clouds.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, virtual machines are replicated from a primary VMM site to Azure using Hyper-V Replica.
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, virtual machines are replicated from a primary VMM site to Azure using Hyper-V Replica.

trans-unit.source: The article includes prerequisites for the scenario, and shows you how to set up a Site Recovery vault, install the Azure Site Recovery Provider on the source VMM server, register the server in the vault, add an Azure storage account, install the Azure Recovery Services agent on Hyper-V host servers, configure protection settings for VMM clouds that will be applied to all protected virtual machines, and then enable protection for those virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: The article includes prerequisites for the scenario, and shows you how to set up a Site Recovery vault, install the Azure Site Recovery Provider on the source VMM server, register the server in the vault, add an Azure storage account, install the Azure Recovery Services agent on Hyper-V host servers, configure protection settings for VMM clouds that will be applied to all protected virtual machines, and then enable protection for those virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Finish up by testing the failover to make sure everything's working as expected.
trans-unit.target: Finish up by testing the failover to make sure everything's working as expected.

trans-unit.source: If you run into problems setting up this scenario, post your questions on the <linkText>Azure Recovery Services Forum</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you run into problems setting up this scenario, post your questions on the <linkText>Azure Recovery Services Forum</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have these prerequisites in place:
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have these prerequisites in place:

trans-unit.source: You'll need a <linkText>Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title> account.
trans-unit.target: You'll need a <linkText>Microsoft Azure</linkText><title></title> account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have one, start with a <linkText>free trial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have one, start with a <linkText>free trial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In addition, you can read about <linkText>Azure Site Recovery Manager pricing</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: In addition, you can read about <linkText>Azure Site Recovery Manager pricing</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You'll need an Azure storage account to store data replicated to Azure.
trans-unit.target: You'll need an Azure storage account to store data replicated to Azure.

trans-unit.source: The account needs geo-replication enabled.
trans-unit.target: The account needs geo-replication enabled.

trans-unit.source: It should be in the same region as the Azure Site Recovery service, and be associated with the same subscription.
trans-unit.target: It should be in the same region as the Azure Site Recovery service, and be associated with the same subscription.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about setting up Azure storage, see <linkText>Introduction to Microsoft Azure Storage</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about setting up Azure storage, see <linkText>Introduction to Microsoft Azure Storage</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You'll need to make sure that virtual machines you want to protect comply with Azure requirements.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to make sure that virtual machines you want to protect comply with Azure requirements.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Virtual machine support</linkText><title></title> for details.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Virtual machine support</linkText><title></title> for details.

trans-unit.source: You'll need VMM server running on System Center 2012 R2.
trans-unit.target: You'll need VMM server running on System Center 2012 R2.

trans-unit.source: Any VMM server containing virtual machines you want to protect must be running the Azure Site Recovery Provider.
trans-unit.target: Any VMM server containing virtual machines you want to protect must be running the Azure Site Recovery Provider.

trans-unit.source: This is installed during the Azure Site Recovery deployment.
trans-unit.target: This is installed during the Azure Site Recovery deployment.

trans-unit.source: You'll need at least one cloud on the VMM server you want to protect.
trans-unit.target: You'll need at least one cloud on the VMM server you want to protect.

trans-unit.source: The cloud should contain:
trans-unit.target: The cloud should contain:

trans-unit.source: One or more VMM host groups.
trans-unit.target: One or more VMM host groups.

trans-unit.source: One or more Hyper-V host servers or clusters in each host group .
trans-unit.target: One or more Hyper-V host servers or clusters in each host group .

trans-unit.source: One or more virtual machines on the source Hyper-V server.
trans-unit.target: One or more virtual machines on the source Hyper-V server.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about setting up VMM clouds:
trans-unit.target: Learn more about setting up VMM clouds:

trans-unit.source: Read more about private VMM clouds in <linkText>What’s New in Private Cloud with System Center 2012 R2 VMM</linkText><title></title> and in <linkText>VMM 2012 and the clouds</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Read more about private VMM clouds in <linkText>What’s New in Private Cloud with System Center 2012 R2 VMM</linkText><title></title> and in <linkText>VMM 2012 and the clouds</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Learn about <linkText>Configuring the VMM cloud fabric</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Learn about <linkText>Configuring the VMM cloud fabric</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: After your cloud fabric elements are in place learn about creating private clouds in <linkText>Creating a private cloud in VMM</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Walkthrough: Creating private clouds with System Center 2012 SP1 VMM</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: After your cloud fabric elements are in place learn about creating private clouds in <linkText>Creating a private cloud in VMM</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Walkthrough: Creating private clouds with System Center 2012 SP1 VMM</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The host Hyper-V servers must be running at least Windows Server 2012 with Hyper-V role and have the latest updates installed.
trans-unit.target: The host Hyper-V servers must be running at least Windows Server 2012 with Hyper-V role and have the latest updates installed.

trans-unit.source: If you're running Hyper-V in a cluster note that cluster broker isn't created automatically if you have a static IP address-based cluster.
trans-unit.target: If you're running Hyper-V in a cluster note that cluster broker isn't created automatically if you have a static IP address-based cluster.

trans-unit.source: You'll need to configure the cluster broker manually.
trans-unit.target: You'll need to configure the cluster broker manually.

trans-unit.source: For instructions see <linkText>Configure Hyper-V Replica Broker</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions see <linkText>Configure Hyper-V Replica Broker</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Any Hyper-V host server or cluster for which you want to manage protection must be included in a VMM cloud.
trans-unit.target: Any Hyper-V host server or cluster for which you want to manage protection must be included in a VMM cloud.

trans-unit.source: When you protect virtual machines in Azure network mapping maps between VM networks on the source VMM server and target Azure networks to enable the following:
trans-unit.target: When you protect virtual machines in Azure network mapping maps between VM networks on the source VMM server and target Azure networks to enable the following:

trans-unit.source: All machines which fail over on the same network can connect to each other, irrespective of which recovery plan they are in.
trans-unit.target: All machines which fail over on the same network can connect to each other, irrespective of which recovery plan they are in.

trans-unit.source: If a network gateway is setup on the target Azure network, virtual machines can connect to other on-premises virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: If a network gateway is setup on the target Azure network, virtual machines can connect to other on-premises virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: If you don’t configure network mapping only virtual machines that fail over in the same recovery plan will be able to connect to each other after failover to Azure.
trans-unit.target: If you don’t configure network mapping only virtual machines that fail over in the same recovery plan will be able to connect to each other after failover to Azure.

trans-unit.source: If you want to deploy network mapping you'll need the following:
trans-unit.target: If you want to deploy network mapping you'll need the following:

trans-unit.source: The virtual machines you want to protect on the source VMM server should be connected to a VM network.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machines you want to protect on the source VMM server should be connected to a VM network.

trans-unit.source: That network should be linked to a logical network that is associated with the cloud.
trans-unit.target: That network should be linked to a logical network that is associated with the cloud.

trans-unit.source: An Azure network to which replicated virtual machines can connect after failover.
trans-unit.target: An Azure network to which replicated virtual machines can connect after failover.

trans-unit.source: You'll select this network at the time of failover.
trans-unit.target: You'll select this network at the time of failover.

trans-unit.source: The network should be in the same region as your Azure Site Recovery subscription.
trans-unit.target: The network should be in the same region as your Azure Site Recovery subscription.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about network mapping:
trans-unit.target: Learn more about network mapping:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configuring logical networking in VMM</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configuring logical networking in VMM</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configuring VM networks and gateways in VMM</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configuring VM networks and gateways in VMM</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure and monitor virtual networks in Azure</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure and monitor virtual networks in Azure</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have Azure PowerShell ready to go.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have Azure PowerShell ready to go.

trans-unit.source: If you are already using PowerShell, you'll need to upgrade to version 0.8.10 or later.
trans-unit.target: If you are already using PowerShell, you'll need to upgrade to version 0.8.10 or later.

trans-unit.source: For information about setting up PowerShell, see <linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about setting up PowerShell, see <linkText>How to install and configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Once you have set up and configured PowerShell, you can view all of the available cmdlets for the service <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Once you have set up and configured PowerShell, you can view all of the available cmdlets for the service <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To learn about tips that can help you use the cmdlets, such as how parameter values, inputs, and outputs are typically handled in Azure PowerShell, see <linkText>Get Started with Azure Cmdlets</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To learn about tips that can help you use the cmdlets, such as how parameter values, inputs, and outputs are typically handled in Azure PowerShell, see <linkText>Get Started with Azure Cmdlets</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In PowerShell, run these cmdlets:
trans-unit.target: In PowerShell, run these cmdlets:

trans-unit.source: Replace the elements within the "< >" with your specific information.
trans-unit.target: Replace the elements within the "< >" with your specific information.

trans-unit.source: In PowerShell, replace the elements within the "< >" with your specific information, and run these commands:
trans-unit.target: In PowerShell, replace the elements within the "< >" with your specific information, and run these commands:

trans-unit.source: Generate a registration key in the vault.
trans-unit.target: Generate a registration key in the vault.

trans-unit.source: After you download the Azure Site Recovery Provider and install it on the VMM server, you'll use this key to register the VMM server in the vault.
trans-unit.target: After you download the Azure Site Recovery Provider and install it on the VMM server, you'll use this key to register the VMM server in the vault.

trans-unit.source: Get the vault setting file and set the context:
trans-unit.target: Get the vault setting file and set the context:

trans-unit.source: Set the vault context by running the following commands:
trans-unit.target: Set the vault context by running the following commands:

trans-unit.source: Enable the DR for the VM by running the following command:
trans-unit.target: Enable the DR for the VM by running the following command:

trans-unit.source: $jobResult = Set-AzureSiteRecoveryProtectionEntity -ProtectionEntity $protectionEntity -Protection Enable -Force
trans-unit.target: $jobResult = Set-AzureSiteRecoveryProtectionEntity -ProtectionEntity $protectionEntity -Protection Enable -Force

trans-unit.source: To test your deployment you can run a test failover for a single virtual machine, or create a recovery plan consisting of multiple virtual machines and run a test failover for the plan.
trans-unit.target: To test your deployment you can run a test failover for a single virtual machine, or create a recovery plan consisting of multiple virtual machines and run a test failover for the plan.

trans-unit.source: Test failover simulates your failover and recovery mechanism in an isolated network.
trans-unit.target: Test failover simulates your failover and recovery mechanism in an isolated network.

trans-unit.source: Note that:
trans-unit.target: Note that:

trans-unit.source: If you want to connect to the virtual machine in Azure using Remote Desktop after the failover, enable Remote Desktop Connection on the virtual machine before you run the test failover.
trans-unit.target: If you want to connect to the virtual machine in Azure using Remote Desktop after the failover, enable Remote Desktop Connection on the virtual machine before you run the test failover.

trans-unit.source: After failover, you'll use a public IP address to connect to the virtual machine in Azure using Remote Desktop.
trans-unit.target: After failover, you'll use a public IP address to connect to the virtual machine in Azure using Remote Desktop.

trans-unit.source: If you want to do this, ensure you don't have any domain policies that prevent you from connecting to a virtual machine using a public address.
trans-unit.target: If you want to do this, ensure you don't have any domain policies that prevent you from connecting to a virtual machine using a public address.

trans-unit.source: To check the completion of the operation, follow the steps in <linkText>Monitor Activity</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To check the completion of the operation, follow the steps in <linkText>Monitor Activity</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Create an .xml file as a template for your recovery plan using the data below, and then save it as "C:\RPTemplatePath.xml".
trans-unit.target: Create an .xml file as a template for your recovery plan using the data below, and then save it as "C:\RPTemplatePath.xml".

trans-unit.source: Change the RecoveryPlan node Id, Name, PrimaryServerId, and SecondaryServerId.
trans-unit.target: Change the RecoveryPlan node Id, Name, PrimaryServerId, and SecondaryServerId.

trans-unit.source: Change the ProtectionEntity node PrimaryProtectionEntityId (vmid from VMM).
trans-unit.target: Change the ProtectionEntity node PrimaryProtectionEntityId (vmid from VMM).

trans-unit.source: You can add more VMs by adding more ProtectionEntity nodes.
trans-unit.target: You can add more VMs by adding more ProtectionEntity nodes.

trans-unit.source: Fill in the data in the template:
trans-unit.target: Fill in the data in the template:

trans-unit.source: Create the RecoveryPlan:
trans-unit.target: Create the RecoveryPlan:

trans-unit.source: Get the RecoveryPlan object by running the following command:
trans-unit.target: Get the RecoveryPlan object by running the following command:

trans-unit.source: Start the test failover by running the following command:
trans-unit.target: Start the test failover by running the following command:

trans-unit.source: Use the following commands to monitor the activity.
trans-unit.target: Use the following commands to monitor the activity.

trans-unit.source: Note that you have to wait in between jobs for the processing to finish.
trans-unit.target: Note that you have to wait in between jobs for the processing to finish.

trans-unit.target: <UL>

trans-unit.source: • For more information about Azure Site Recovery PowerShell cmdlets, see the article here.
trans-unit.target: • For more information about Azure Site Recovery PowerShell cmdlets, see the article here.

trans-unit.source: • To plan and deploy Azure Site Recovery in a full production environment, see Planning Guide for Azure Site Recovery and Deployment Guide for Azure Site Recovery.
trans-unit.target: • To plan and deploy Azure Site Recovery in a full production environment, see Planning Guide for Azure Site Recovery and Deployment Guide for Azure Site Recovery.

trans-unit.source: • For questions, visit the Azure Recovery Services Forum.
trans-unit.target: • For questions, visit the Azure Recovery Services Forum.
